com.yantra.api.ycd

Interface getCompleteOrderLineDetails

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YCDApi, YIFApi

    public interface getCompleteOrderLineDetails

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getCompleteOrderLineDetails(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      getCompleteOrderLineDetails returns complete information for an order line.

    • Method Detail

      • getCompleteOrderLineDetails

        org.w3c.dom.Document getCompleteOrderLineDetails(YFSEnvironment env,
                                                 org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                          throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                                 java.rmi.RemoteException
        getCompleteOrderLineDetails returns complete information for an order line. getCompleteOrderLineDetails internally will call getOrderLineDetails. In addition to the information returned by getOrderLineDetails API, getCompleteOrderLineDetails will also return a list of important events and a breakup of the state of each quantity of the order line along with any information related to that quantity.
        Important Events getCompleteOrderLineDetails will evaluate and return the following important events
          Canceled: This is determined by parsing the audit tables for the ModificationType of CANCEL.
          Returned: This is determined by using the DerivedFromOrderLineKey attribute.
          Reshipped: This is determined by using the ReshipParentLineKey attribute.
          PriceMatch: This is determined by using the IsPriceMatched flag on the order line. The details however are pulled from the order note where the ReasonCode is YCD_PRICE_MATCH. If no notes exist with this reason code then a single important event will be returned without any additional information.
          PriceOverridden: This is determined by using the IsPriceLocked flag. The details however are pulled from the order note where the ReasonCode is YCD_PRICE_MATCH. Since this flag is also set when a price match is applied. We will not return this important event unless we find a note with this reason code or the IsPriceMatched flag is false.
          Stop Delivery Request: This is determined by the StopDeliveryRequestDetail records.

        Line Tracking Breakup getCompleteOrderLineDetails will evaluate the status of each quantity on the order line and and return detailed information for each in an LineBreakup element. The point of this functionality is to return data to answer the question "Where is my order?" . getCompleteOrderLineDetails will return a LineBreakup element for each container if they exist. Thus an order line which is in a single status may return multiple LineBreakup elements. The PersonInfoShipTo under the LineBreakup element is the address on the shipment. If the shipment does not have an address or does not exist the address will come from the order line. If the order line does not have a ship to address then the address from the order header will be returned. For orders with quantity passed 3700 status. The API will not return OrderStatus elements. This is because the link between the status and shipment gets lost. Instead the API will start to return LineBreakup elements based on specific milestones. These milestones will always be 3700 or 3900.
        Line Tracking Exception As mentioned above, the main point of the line tracking functionality is meant to determine where the order line is. In some instances the exceptions occur during fulfillment that prevent the order from being processed. These conditions are returned as LineExceptions. getCompleteOrderLineDetails will evaluate and return the following line exceptions.
          Delay: This is determined by using the FTC OrderDate records on the line.
          Hold: This is determined using the OrderHoldType records on the line. A hold exception is only returned if the hold was applied at the order line level and has not been resolved.
          Stop Delvery Request: This is determined by the StopDeliveryRequestDetail records.
          Reshipped: This is determined by using the ReshipParentLineKey attribute.

        LIMITATIONS This API does not work for shipments which were not created off a release. In these scenarios the line breakup elements will not have any shipment information associated to them.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:

          com.yantra.pca.ycd.japi.ue.YCDCanPriceMatchBePerformedUE
            This user exit will be called internally by the API. The error code YCD00036 is thrown if an exception occurs during the invocation of this user exit.
            com.yantra.pca.ycd.japi.ue.YCDGetTrackingNumberURLUE
              This user exit will be called internally by the API if the URL attribute is prresent on either the Shipment or Container elements.

            Events Raised: None

            Audits: None

            Pre-conditions: None

            Post-conditions: None

            Output Template Support: Yes

            Database Extensibility Support: Yes

            Additional Information



        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. Contains attributes of the address that is to be verified. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains the address details as well as a status representing if the verification succeeded, failed, or could not be performed. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
